name: Buffalo Dip with Rotisserie Chicken
author: Bibi
summary: Use some leftover rotisserie chicken to create this dip that will remind you of Buffalo wings. You will find all the flavors you love, without the bones! Serve with celery and carrot sticks. Provide additional hot sauce for individual tastes.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups shredded skinless rotisserie chicken breast
½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into chunks
⅓ cup Buffalo-style hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's® Red Hot®)
2 tablespoons crumbled blue cheese, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease a 3-cup oven-proof serving dish with cooking spray
Combine shredded chicken, cream cheese, and cayenne in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat
Stir until cream cheese has melted, 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in ranch dressing, remove from heat, and pour into the prepared dish
Spread Buffalo sauce evenly over top and sprinkle with Cheddar
Bake in the preheated oven until dip is warmed through and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with blue cheese
